Radulović: Vlast pokušava da zastraši gradjane koji prilaze štandu DJB

04 Nov 2019, 13:55

Predsednik DJB Saša Radulović poručio je danas da predstavnicima vlasti nije dovoljan samo medijski mrak kako bi sprečili gradjane da čuju poruke i politiku DJB, već pokušavaju i da zastraše one koji prilaze štandu tog pokreta."Prošlog ponedeljka, uz nasilnu pretnju, SNS vlast u Surčinu je pokušala da nas zastraši. Kada su čuli da ćemo nastaviti sa izlascima na ulicu i razgovor sa gradjanima, danas su izveli preko 50 SNS aktivista koji su mahom zaposleni u Opštini Surčin i javnom sektoru, i pokušali da zastraše gradjane da ne prilaze našem štandu", rekao je Radulović, navodi se u saopštenju DJB.Kazao je da uprkos tome narod prilazi i da se u odnosu na prethodne godine oseća da je strah manji, ali da se oseća i beznadje i to da ljudi "ne vide svetlo na kraju tunela"."Znajući sve ovo, EU zvaničnici i dalje redovno dolaze u Srbiju i svaki put izjavljuju da 'Srbija ide u dobrom pravcu'", rekao je Radulovć.On je ocenio da je predsednik Srbije Aleksandar Vučić politiku Srbije podredio nemačkoj politici koja od Balkana pravi "svoju koloniju jeftine radne snage u koju će naseljavati migrante za svoje fabrike za motanje kablova"."Zbog toga i ima bezrezervnu podršku EU. Nemačka nema boljeg političara u Srbiji od Vučića da sprovodi njihove interese i zato ga nikada neće pustiti niz vodu", rekao je Radulović.Radulović se sa potpredsednicom Pokreta Hanom Adrović priključio akciji opštinskog odbora DJB Surčin koji svakog ponedeljka na štandu razgovara s gradjanima te opštine.

Radulovic: Authorities are trying to intimidate citizens approaching the DJB booth

04 Nov 2019, 12:55

DJB President Sasa Radulovic announced today that government officials need not only media darkness to prevent citizens from hearing the messages and politics of DJB, but also try to intimidate those who approach the booth of the movement. "Last Monday, with a violent threat, SNS authorities in Surcin tried to intimidate us. When they heard that we would continue to go out and talk to the citizens, today they took out over 50 SNS activists, mostly employed in the municipality of Surčin and the public sector, and tried to intimidate the citizens from approaching our booth. " , said Radbovic, according to a statement from the DJB. He said that despite this, the people were approaching and that, compared to previous years, they felt that fear was less, but that it was hopeless and that people "do not see the light at the end of the tunnel". "Knowing all this, EU officials continue to come to Serbia on a regular basis and each time declare that 'Serbia is going in the right direction'," Radulovic said. He estimated that Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic p He subordinated the Serbian policy to German policy that makes the Balkans "a colony of cheap labor into which migrants are migrated to their cable plants." "Therefore, it has unreserved support from the EU. Germany has no better politician in Serbia than Vucic to pursue their interests and will therefore never let him down the water, "Radulovic said. Radulovic and Vice President of the Movement Han Adrovic joined the action of the municipal board of DJB Surcin who talks with the citizens of the municipality every Monday.
